title: Contributions and Insurability) (Amendment) (No. 2) (Attribution of selfemployment contributions) Regulations 2022.
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Contributions and Insurability) (Amendment) (No. 2) (Attribution of selfemployment contributions) Regulations 2022. 

(2) These Regulations and the Social Welfare (Consolidated Contributions 
and Insurability) Regulations 1996 to 2022 shall be construed together as one 
and may be cited together as the Social Welfare (Consolidated Contributions 
and Insurability) Regulations 1996 to 2022. 

Attribution of Self-Employment Contributions

title: Contributions and Insurability) (Amendment) (No. 2) (Attribution of selfemployment contributions) Regulations 2022.
heading: 2. Article 27 (inserted by article 2 of the Social Welfare (Consolidated
text_raw:
2. Article 27 (inserted by article 2 of the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Contributions and Insurability) (Amendment) (No. 2) (Attribution of selfemployment contributions) Regulations 2021 (S.I. No. 730 of 2021)), is 
amended, by the substitution of “in each of the 2020 and 2021 contribution 
years.” for “the 2020 contribution year.”. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 10th October, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform consents to the making of the 
foregoing Regulations. 

[747] 3 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

14 December, 2022. 

MICHAEL MCGRATH, 

Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

14 December, 2022. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Social Protection. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [747]

title: Contributions and Insurability) (Amendment) (No. 2) (Attribution of selfemployment contributions) Regulations 2022.
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

Section 38E(4) (inserted by section 8 of the Social Welfare (Covid-19) 
(Amendment) Act 2020 (No. 12 of 2020)) of the Social Welfare Consolidation 
Act 2005 allows the Minister for Social Protection, with the consent of the 
Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform, to make regulations prescribing 
the number of self-employment contributions to be attributed to a selfemployed contributor who was entitled to and in receipt of the Covid-19 
pandemic unemployment payment, or a jobseeker’s payment (who would 
otherwise be entitled to the Covid-19 pandemic unemployment payment). 

and 

The Social Welfare 
(Consolidated Contributions 
Insurability) 
(Attribution of self-employment contributions) 
(No. 2) 
(Amendment) 
Regulations 2021 (S.I. No. 730 of 2021) inserted a new article 27 into the 
Social Welfare (Consolidated Contributions and Insurability) Regulations

title: Contributions and Insurability) (Amendment) (No. 2) (Attribution of selfemployment contributions) Regulations 2022.
heading: 1996. Article 27 provided that a self-employed contributor entitled to and in
text_raw:
1996. Article 27 provided that a self-employed contributor entitled to and in 
receipt of the Covid-19 pandemic unemployment payment, or a jobseeker’s 
payment (who would otherwise be entitled to the Covid-19 pandemic 
unemployment payment), was deemed to have made 52 self-employment 
contributions in the 2020 contribution year. 

These Regulations amend article 27 of the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Contributions and Insurability) Regulations 1996 to provide, in respect of the 
2021 contribution year (where the same circumstances apply) a self-employed 
contributor shall be deemed to have made 52 self-employment contributions.
